intro: Malache rosa-campestris, commonly known as the pink-stemmed malache, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, pinkish stems and small, palmate leaves. It produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
